wikipedia_page.main: Edward Forster FRS FSA (1769–1828) was an English cleric and miscellany writer.

response: * Edward Forster the Elder (1730–1812), English banker and antiquary
* Edward Forster the Younger (1765–1849), English banker and botanist, son of Edward Forster the Elder
* Edward Forster (writer) (1769–1828), English cleric and miscellaneous writer

He also executed the plates for Edward Forster's British Gallery, many of those for John Bell's British Theatre, and all the illustrations in Thomas Frognall Dibdin's Ædes Althorpianæ, published in 1822, after which he undertook no important work.

About 1803 Savage went also into business as a printer in London on his own account. In 1807 he was commissioned to print Edward Forster's British Gallery of Engravings, It made his reputation as printer.
